Chappal Waddi is a hill in Nigeria and, at 2,419 meters, is the country's highest point. It is located in Taraba State, near the border with Cameroon, in the Gashaka-Gumpti Forest Reserve and Gashaka-Gumpti National Park on the Mambilla Plateau. It is cited as the highest point in sub-Saharan Africa. #NaijaLife #StanbicIBTC

SCAM ALERT 
Our attention has been brought to the Facebook page of Stanbic IBTC Investment company ( https://www.facebook.com/Stanbic-IBTC-investment-company-100345524952307/ ). The owners of this page have been subtly parading themselves as representatives of Stanbic IBTC Holdings PLC. We wish to inform you that Stanbic IBTC is in no way associated with the owners of and activities of the page on Facebook, the group and whatsapp and any other platform that they may promote. 
Our social media pages can be found on 
Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/StanbicIBTC/
Twitter - https://twitter.com/StanbicIBTC
Linkedin - https://www.linkedin.com/company/stanbic-ibtc/
YouTube - https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCwUD-4G5E1FRomeHK1Uc99w
Instagram - https://www.instagram.com/stanbicibtc/ 
While we work with the relevant authorities to apprehend the owners of these platforms, we would like to emphasise that they are not staff of or in any way representatives of Stanbic IBTC or any of its subsidiaries. You are advised to desist from doing business with them as any business/ transaction/ contract or agreement entered into with them is carried out at your own risk. 
Should you have any enquiries about any of our businesses, please contact our customer care number on 0700 909 909 909 for clarification.

We are conscious of the challenges that many of us are facing during this pandemic but getting your pension details shouldn‚Äôt be one of them. With Stanbic IBTC Pensions, you can literally access your pension account at your fingertips using our short code service. Here are ways to access/monitor your pension account at your fingertips with our short code service.üòâ

In addition, did you know that you can generate your statement online?
Simply follow the steps below:

Step 1: Visit www.stanbicibtcpension.com and look to the right hand of the screen (middle section). Click on the drop down button and select ‚ÄúRSA Login‚Äù.

Step 2: Another window will appear advising you to login with your RSA PIN and Passcode or Registered Mobile Number and Passcode or Registered Email Address and Passcode which will take you to your account summary page (If you do not have your login details, kindly click on the ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt know your passcode‚Äô‚Äô link; where you will be required 
to enter your complete 12 digit PIN number (starting with ‚ÄúPEN‚Äù without space). Once you have done this, your login details will be sent to your registered e-mail address and mobile number.

Step 3: Click on the ‚ÄúSTATEMENT‚Äù link on the Account Summary page.

Step 4: Enter the dates for which you want the statement to be generated and click ‚ÄúDownload Statement‚Äù. Your statement would download in a new tab. Bonus Tip: Please ensure to enable pop-up windows on your browser settings. 

For more information, kindly call 01 271 600 or email pensionsolution@stanbicibtc.com Have a wonderful week ahead üòâ#WealthWednesday #HappenToLife

Hello fam #SavingsGeng! 
This week, we will be discussing the importance of making Voluntary Contributions (VC) to your pension fund. Voluntary Contributions (VCs) are additional contributions that can be made alongside the mandatory contributions remitted by your employer to your Retirement Savings Account (RSA).
----------
Yes, we do understand that these are difficult times. But, guess what ‚Äì a Naira saved is a Naira earned. So, if you want to #HappenToLife without worries, this is for you! 
----------
To make additional contributions into your RSA account, all you need to do is speak with your employer to make the necessary deductions from your monthly salary. Yes, it‚Äôs that simple and seamless! 
---------
You should also note that Voluntary Contributions could be any amount of your choice, it could be as little as N1,000, as long it is from your legitimate income and not more than 1/3 of your monthly salary, in line with the Labour Act, 1990.
----------
You are eligible to withdraw only 50% of your VC as long as the contributions have been retained in the account for at least 2 years. Subsequent withdrawals will be made after 2 years from the last withdrawal date. That is, if your last withdrawal date was January 2017, your next withdrawal date would be anytime from February 2019.
----------
For more information, email pensionsolution@stanbicibtc.com 
Have a great and productive week! üòä

‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢
Our relationship was hard at first for several reasons. We got together on the heels of other relationships, plus there is a 5-year age difference between us, and we both wanted to be in control. We went through some heavy judgment from our community. We argued and fought passionately over so many things: money, sex, time together, career goals, etc. We didn't think we'd make it. There were many times when we'd sit together in sadness, crying over the thought that we might lose each other. There was so much love between us, but we had no clue how to deal with these issues. We felt stuck, miserable, and very angry. We made a decision to give our relationship just six more months (as a last resort), and if it didn't change, we would let go of each other. During this six-month period, we were each to be completely who we were. This meant not hiding or pretending or compromising our individual beliefs and desires. We also attended couples therapy on a weekly basis. During this last-resort period, we were afforded an opportunity to really 'see' each other for who we were versus who we thought the other was or how we wanted the other to be. It was a time to get real. We discovered that we were each doing backflips to show 'love' to the other in ways that wasn't meaningful to that person. That was a huge 'aha' moment! It meant that I got to stop bringing her flowers and instead would sit [with her] to forecast our budget. She learned that the act of paying the bills was not an intimate act for me and that I preferred time talking together. Our marriage is so beautiful now. We really know each other.
@stanbicibtc 
#lovewithstanbicibtc

Thanks so much @stanbicibtc for this great opportunity .
Saving was really an easy thing for me while growing up , because I felt money will always come any how and anywhere, so I felt there was no need saving.
Thanks to My Treasure, who taught me on the importance of saving for rainy days. 
In our journey of love , my saving altitude has really improved and I have seen the good and importance of saving.
I won't forget in 2021, when my husband suggested we saved to buy a landed property by December 2021, I was actually complained because I knew my expenses will be reduced. All thanks to him who encouraged me and we started saving bit by bit. Honestly we got the money before December and bought the land, by February 2022, surrounded lands increased to almost two times the price we bought. Currently, people who have lands in that area are counted as big boys because the price is so high now.
I am so happy we saved and bought the land.
Indeed saving pays .

PCOS develops during puberty around the time of the first menstrual period though the exact cause is unknown. Factors that might play a role in causing PCOS include- (Check slide 2) 
Early diagnosis and treatment of PCOS along with weight loss may reduce the risk of long-term complications such as type 2 diabetes and heart disease. Complications that could arise as a result of PCOS include - (Check slide 3) 
Treatment of PCOS should focus on managing individual concerns, please do see a Medical Doctor if you have experienced any of these symptoms #PCOSAwarenessMonth

The other day, someone tweeted about akara sellers making up to 600k per month! Lool!
While this particular figure is likely an exaggeration, especially when you consider the many daily running costs, it is no secret that Nigerian women are deeply enterprising.
 
I would know! The sheer number of applicants for our enterprise challenge every year, whew!
 
But how can we help these women scale up their businesses in the current clime? How do you convince a road side business owner to take a loan that will be good for her business when the very process of taking the loan is keeping her from business?
 
Long processing hours, impossible collateral, excruciating interest rates and more. All these are barriers to getting proper business funding.
 
STANBIC IBTC has come to change that narrative for good.
 
Stanbic IBTC has made the process of application and collection simple and seamless whether you are a new customer or an existing customer, you can access as low as N50,000 or as high as N10,000,000 to support your working capital and meet up with your customer demand.
 
Visit www.stanbicibtcbank.com or contact the Stanbic IBTC Enterprise Direct team by calling 0700 333 3333 or sending an email to enterprisedirect@stanbicibtc.com to get started.

Our Independently Managed Portfolios (IMP) are discretionary management agreements whereby clients delegate the day to day investment decisions and implementation of their chosen investment strategy to Stanbic IBTC Asset management Limited, while retaining the full beneficial ownership of their investments. 

Our Portfolio Managers will initially meet with you to discuss your investment objectives. Then, in consultation with you and your advisers (where applicable), we will agree on a core investment strategy. The Portfolio Manager will then build a portfolio tailored to meet your investment objectives and requirements, and actively manage it going forward. 
It is important to note that the minimum required amount for portfolio management is 100million, above are some of the benefits.

To know more, call 01 280 1266 or email assetmanagement@stanbicibtc.com

The COVID-19 pandemic, followed by the lockdown has surely left many of us introspecting on how blessed our lives are, and how much of it we may have taken for granted. It is obvious now more than ever that tomorrow is not promised, so the best attitude to have, is to live every day like it‚Äôs your last (even as you plan for the future).
----------
Speaking of the future, let us talk about Wills. A Will is a legal document that sets out who you want to receive your assets when you pass on. You can choose to write a simple Will or a comprehensive Will. 
----------
It is very important that you put a #Legacee in place as you write down your wishes in a Will. This ensures a seamless transfer of your assets to your loved ones and family disputes can be avoided. You also have peace of mind knowing that if anything happens to you, your beneficiaries are catered for with the assets you have stated in your Will which in many instances is only known to you and may be lost if you had not written it down in your Will. 
----------
Imagine the consequences of not putting a #Legacee in place and leaving things to chance - they could unfold in ways you do not want. So while you are staying safe, be sure to reach out to us via Legacee@stanbicibtc.com to get you started on putting a Legacee in place and avoid stories that touch. #WealthWednesday

Stanbic IBTC and NFF put pen to paper on a N2.3 billion annual partnership deal 

Stanbic IBTC Holdings PLC, a member of Standard Bank Group, has partnered with the Nigerian Football Federation (NFF) to further develop football in Nigeria. The signed MoU between Stanbic IBTC and NFF is slated to be effective from 2022.

Under the agreed terms, Stanbic IBTC will provide Group Life Insurance for all 35 players of the national team with a total sum assured of N1.75 Billion Naira and Total Personal Accident insurance for all 35 players with a total of N583,000,000 annually for the next 3 years. Stanbic IBTC will also provide gender sensitivity support for female sports correspondents in Nigeria.

Dr Demola Sogunle, Chief Executive, Stanbic IBTC Holdings PLC, spoke of the landmark agreement. ‚ÄúToday, you are all witnesses to a landmark event: the consummation of a partnership geared towards driving the growth of football in Nigeria. We are all gathered here to grace this momentous occasion as two great Nigerian institutions come together to advance Nigeria‚Äôs most popular sport. With this partnership, we will further drive the development of the youths via football.‚Äù

According to Sogunle, the partnership was based on youth empowerment and football development which he described as values shared by Stanbic IBTC and the Nigerian Football Federation.

On the partnership with Stanbic IBTC, Amaju Pinnick said: ‚ÄúThis has been a historic and one of the most unique sports contracts we have had in a long while and we are excited that Stanbic IBTC is driving not just a partnership with the NFF but a sponsorship that also encourages the advancement of the female gender.‚Äù

Bukola Olopade, Managing Director Nilayo Sports Management Limited, consultant to the partnership said, ‚ÄúThis agreement is the most unique we have signed so far because it directly benefits the players and also contributes to the advancement of the girl child.‚Äù

Credit Nairametrics

When I look back to the beginning of our relationship, I can‚Äôt believe that our love has blossomed into what it is now. I am so lucky to have someone so respectful, caring, understandable and affectionateüíñ.

You said you will be with me through thick and thin, raining, sunny, good, bad, hot or cold weather and you proved that to me countless. #Repost @smartest_collections 
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢
The first time I met Jeremy was when I tried out for an improv group in college. He thought I was the most annoying person he had ever met. Fast forward to a year later, and I finally won him over. We were friends for a few years in college, but the year he graduated we had a falling out. I didn't speak to Jeremy for about three years.

Then, one day after I moved to NYC, I was walking through Union Square and he ran up to me and knocked my hat off my head. He doesn't remember it that way, but that is how I remember it. I was like, 'Oh great. Here's that huge jerk.' So, we talked a little and parted ways. After that, we slowly started rebuilding our friendship. It was probably about a month or two later that Jeremy realized he had fallen in love with me. I wasn't having it, though. For six months (I think it was six months), he pursued me. He wasn't super aggressive, but he made it clear that he wanted to be with me. He didn't buy me flowers or gifts or anything. He was just always there. When I needed something, he was there. When I needed a person to talk to, he was there. When I needed help moving, he was there. When I needed someone to walk me home, he was there. Finally, just before New Year's Day of 2006, I realized that I wanted him to continue being there. Jeremy likes to say that the moment he fell in love with me was the moment he realized that he 'wanted to see me tomorrow.' He would wake up and think, 'I want to see Autumn today' or 'I hope I see Autumn tomorrow.' Once he realized that he was having that same thought every single day, he knew he was in it for real. Anyway, after I agreed to 'date' him. We went on, I think, one official 'date' and that was it. We were in it for the long haul. 11 years and one kid later, I regret nothing!"
@stanbicibtc 
#lovewithstanbicibtc
#goforlove

"I met my significant other in church, where he was the guest speaker. I was new in that church myself, but the church musician, a friend, who had introduced me to the church, also introduced me to Grant before the service, saying, 'Grant, I want you to meet a special lady.' I was completely taken with him, both in our convo before the service and then while listening to his sermon. A month later, when he returned as guest speaker again, I sought him out during Fellowship after the service, and he said he'd like to get together to talk about writing. (I'm a freelance writer/editor.) I invited him over for dinner (don't remember now what I cooked), after dinner we had sex, and we never did get around to talking about writing. More dates followed. Twice he dumped me because we were getting too close and it made him nervous, and twice he dumped me when an old girlfriend of his came back into the picture, but I won out in the long run ‚Äî we've been living together for over a decade now."

How to care for kids born without limbs. #TuesdayThoughts

Congenital amputation can be a devastating experience for both the parents and child. It comes with adjustments no one plans for and realities that can be hard to accept. Here are a few #thoughts we have on being there for a child who may need you:

1. Emotional support: Everyone does better when they know they are loved, especially children. This is the first and most important thing a child needs. 
2. Psychological support: It may be too much to cope with even as a parent or guardian, but you must remember to teach them to believe in their abilities, regardless of what has happened 
3. Physical support: Ensure to get them the right prosthesis for their age and the medical care they need ‚Äì dedicated physiotherapy usually helps. It is also important that you show them how to do things themselves.

Do you know that you can only have one Retirement Savings Account (RSA)? Once you have opened an #RSA, you are required to maintain only that account. 
If for some reason, you have opened two or more Retirement Savings accounts previously, the law presumes that the first account opened is the valid account and invalidates all subsequent accounts opened. 
When you change jobs, simply provide your new employer with your existing RSA PIN to continue making your pension payments into your existing account. 
If you currently have multiple retirement savings accounts, please speak with your PFA today to find out the procedure for resolving the multiple accounts.

If you have been monitoring your pension account like we advised, you might have noticed that your balance has been earning some returns. 
But have you ever wondered how the funds in your pension account are being managed? We think it‚Äôs important to know, so, we will be providing some insight to that.

#PenCom has provided an investment guideline and this guides PFAs as regards asset classes and exposure PFAs can have to these different Asset Classes.

Presently, contributions from all RSA holders who are not yet retired (irrespective of their age and risk criteria) are invested together as one pool called the RSA Active Fund.

However, beginning from 1 July, 2018, the RSA Active Fund will be split into three funds with different investment criteria. This new structure gives you, the contributor, a choice to opt for more risk/returns by switching between funds where eligible.

The first pool of funds (Fund 1) will have a higher exposure to the equities market (and other assets with varying returns) than all other funds. This is available to RSA holders who are less than 50 years old from commencement of this multi-fund structure.

Fund 2 will be the default fund for all RSA holders who are less than 50 years old as at 1 July, 2018. This fund has a medium exposure to the equities market.

Fund 3 will be the default fund for all RSA holders who are above 50 years as at 1 July, 2018 but are yet to retire. This is a conservative fund with a low exposure to the equities market.

However, the RSA Retirees fund which currently exists and caters to all retirees currently receiving pension will remain as it is and will be called Fund 4.

Want more information, please visit:¬†http://www.stanbicibtcpension.com/PensionManagers/contact-us/Frequently-Asked-Questions. #WealthWednesday

„Éª„Éª„Éª üç´üçåüò≠
Servings: 9√ó5-inch loaf, about 10 slices
INGREDIENTS
3 ripe bananas
2 eggs
¬Ω cup 2% plain greek yogurt
‚Öì cup honey
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 cup wheat flour
¬Ω cup dark cocoa powder
¬Ω cup chocolate chips
#
PREPARATION
1. Preheat the oven to 350ÀöF/180ÀöC.
2. In a medium bowl, mash bananas. Mix eggs, yogurt, honey, vanilla extract, and baking soda into mixture.
3. Add flour, dark cocoa powder and mix.
4. Add chocolate chips and gently fold into mixture.
5. Pour the batter into a greased 9√ó5-inch bread pan. Bake for about 45 mins, or until a toothpick comes out clean from the middle of the bread. (Baking times may vary, so keep an eye on the bread.)
6. Allow to cool for 15 minutes before serving!
7. Enjoy!

Delayed gratification is a beautiful thing. Before you make that splurge, ask yourself: Do I need this? Do I need this now? Can I afford this? #NeverStopInvesting

Work out how much to save each week or month and how long it would take you to reach that goal. 
Be more deliberate and choose an investment plan over a regular savings plan. That way your money is put to work to earn you even more.

Next, automate it. Set up a standing order for the weekly or monthly deductions. This ensures you do not miss any payment.

If you're working towards a larger goal, you may want to break it down into smaller milestones. Nothing is too small to save. 
You could even keep your small change in a ‚Äò‚Äôkolo‚Äò‚Äô until it's up to N5,000 and can then be invested in a mutual fund. 
Review your goal & current financial position frequently. As your income changes, you can adjust your contributions.

Remember to reward yourself! A few extra pieces of meat never hurt anyone. üòÄ reaching your financial goal is worth celebrating.

Hi guys, how well do you know our Pension Laws? 
______

Test your knowledge with this #WealthWednesday trivia. ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
Zaynab had a balance of N4,850,000 in her pension account at the time she passed away. What do you think will happen to this balance? 
Options below, please reply with your answer or quote. 
1.  It is paid to the next of kin stated in the records she has with her chosen PFA

2.  Once the PFA becomes aware of her demise, it will be transferred to her bank account by word of mouth

3. ¬†Her PFA gets to keep the money, even when they are aware that the account holder has died

4.  The funds are paid to the beneficiaries stated on her will or letter of administration. 
________

According to the pension reform act, when a pension account holder passes on, the funds in their account goes to the beneficiary recognized by law. ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
This means that the funds can only be paid to the named beneficiary in a Will.¬† In the absence of a Will, the funds can then be released to the person who obtains and is named in the letter of Administration. ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢

To ensure that your funds are paid to your intended beneficiary (ies) and save them the rigors of getting a letter of administration, we advise that you put a Will in place. See how¬†https://twitter.com/StanbicIBTC/status/1057619556171218944

Technology is doing so much for us but it does have drawbacks. For instance, more young people are seeking medical advice for neck and backache due to the excessive use of mobile devices. 
In fact, experts have verified that amongst young people aged between 16 and 34 years, there is a 60 per cent increase in those suffering from ‚Äútech-neck‚Äù. This unnatural posture strains muscles in the neck and chest area and if left unaddressed can increase the risk of pinched nerves, bone spurs and degenerative disk disease. It can also lead to you having a Hunchback. 
The good news is that by being aware of it and taking a few corrective actions, we can minimize and correct the negative (and unattractive) impacts of tech neck. 
How to test for Tech Neck:

The best way to know is to physically see what your spine, shoulder and neck are doing right now. 
Do you have Tech Neck?

If you find yourself looking down more at your smart phone than you did in the past, please review your current posture. Your device viewing position may feel comfortable and completely natural but it doesn‚Äôt mean your posture is great. 
What can one do to prevent Tech Neck?
#WealthWednesday #Phone #StanbicIBTC #Health #Technology

This week we‚Äôll be discussing the importance of having a travel insurance policy. Let‚Äôs start by asking, how often do you take up a travel insurance policy? 
________________________
Why is travel insurance necessary? Well, It is designed to provide financial protection for unexpected events during one‚Äôs trip.

Wondering if and why you need travel insurance? Here are a few benefits to consider;
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ The insurer will provide the individual with dental assistance required abroad.
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ The insurer will pay the cost of hospitalization, surgery, medical fees and pharmaceutical products, prescribed by the attending doctor.
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ Should the insured be hospitalized due to sudden illness or accident for more than 10 days, the insurer will meet the cost of repatriating one immediate family member accompanying the insured at the time of the event to his usual place of residence.
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ The insurer will be responsible for transferring the individual to a properly equipped health centre and repatriating the insured to his/her usual country of residence.

What‚Äôs the first thing you do when you get a major alert?

There is a difference between ‚ÄúMaking money‚Äù and ‚Äúcreating wealth‚Äù. Are you making yourself wealthy or just earning an income?

Have you ever wondered how some sports stars become broke despite making millions during their careers?

Good question. It‚Äôs because wealth is not measured by the amount of money that comes into one‚Äôs pocket, it is measured by the amount that stays there.

Building your wealth requires some self-discipline and deliberate actions.  You need to save and invest to create wealth. Those are the actions required. üòâ

The main idea behind investing is to put money you‚Äôve saved into things you think will go up or at least maintain value over time. What kind of things? You may be asking.

Things like stocks, bonds and real estate. The trick is to buy an asset when the price is low, then try to sell when the price is high. That‚Äôs how you make a profit.

This can be done either on your own or through a professional financial adviser who would invest on your behalf and give you steady income on your investment.

Do you need help figuring out what investments would work best for you to create your desired wealth? We could walk you through our mutual funds, we have several of them.

Why not contact us and let us help you build your wealth? Kindly call 01 280 1266 or email¬†assetmanagement@stanbicibtc.com¬†for more details.

Is it just us or do you guys think people tend to know when we have excess money so they can borrow? üôÑ

Give or lend as you please, but if you realise that you usually have spare cash after all your planned expenses, then this might be a sign that you should save more. #KeepTheChange 
Or if you find yourself spending on certain things too often those cinema tickets, shopping spree or the usual turn up on Fridays, you could also consider this as a sign that you should be saving more.

Now, let‚Äôs create a scenario: How about you forego some of those extra expenses and commit those funds as an additional contribution towards your pension?¬† We call these voluntary contributions. üòâ

Imagine the amount you would have accrued at retirement if you make this slight adjustment for a couple of years! ü§î 
Now it gets interesting, remember pension funds are deducted at source & these deductions are done before taxes. Your voluntary contributions are also treated as such, thus helping you to legitimately save on taxes as you save more towards retirement.

Your voluntary contributions are also invested like the funds in your retirement savings account, which means your total contributions continue to grow thus accomplishing something significantly bigger than the expenditure you had to forego.

That's the amazing power of voluntary contributions. All you need to do is make a deliberate decision to start today. For more information on Voluntary Contribution, please speak to us via 01-2716000. #WealthWednesday #Pension #VoluntaryContribution #Retire

Ingredients
‚Ä¢ 2 cups beans (brown/white) ‚Ä¢ 1 onion ‚Ä¢ 2 fresh pepper ‚Ä¢ 1/2 cup of crayfish (whole/ground) ‚Ä¢ 1 cup of palm oil ‚Ä¢ 2 seasoning cubes ‚Ä¢ Salt to taste ‚Ä¢ 3 eggs .
.
How to prepare
- Peel the beans and blend. Add the onion, fresh pepper and water then blend till smooth.
- Pour the blend in a mixing bowl, add the crayfish, salt to taste and palm oil. Mix thoroughly with a wooden spoon or mixer.
- Add seasoning and water if too thick. - Put in a container or leaf and cook for 10 ‚Äì 15 minutes.
- Serve hot!

Here are some financial tips to ensure you enjoy the season, while making better spending decisions and being prepared for 2018. .
‚úÖ The first step is to assess where you are now. How well did you do with your 2017 goals? Are there areas to improve on? Are there areas where you did well and would like to build on?
. ‚úÖ Set SMART - Specific, Measurable, Attainable, Realistic and Time bound goals.
. ‚úÖ Prioritize your debt. Make a list of your liabilities and expected outflows. You may want to pay some attention to reducing your liabilities.
. ‚úÖ Start an emergency fund with the goal of having the equivalent of about 3- 6 months‚Äô salary saved for the rainy day. Just have something saved!!!
. ‚úÖ Self Development is in! Looking to advance your career next year? Read books, take online courses that will help develop your skills. Develop that random skill of yours.

Holiday plans for next year? Decide early and start planning now! It‚Äôs easier to find deals and work out a good payment plan when you start early 
Remember to enjoy your holidays and celebrate all the hard work and achievements of 2017 but also FOCUS on the future #movingforward.

Hello everyone, we received some new updates from our pension regulator, about withdrawals from your Voluntary Contributions (VC).
.
.
Effective 1 December 2017, only 50% of the VC will be available for withdrawal (subject to tax on income earned) while the 50% balance shall be retained to augment the contributor‚Äôs retirement benefits at retirement. 
Also, withdrawals from VC can only be made once every 2 years, while subsequent withdrawals shall only be on the additional contributions made after the last withdrawal. .
.
For Exempted/Foreign Contributors; withdrawals shall only be once every 2 years. However, total withdrawal of all the funds is allowed subject to tax deduction on both the income earned and principal amount if the withdrawal is done less than 5 years from the date of contribution. .
.
In addition, Pension Fund Administrators (PFAs) & Pension Fund Custodians (PFCs) must report any single transaction of N5m and above to the EFCC.

If you are a return VC withdrawal applicant & would like to process one, please click the link in our bio? If you‚Äôre a first-time applicant, kindly submit your application at any Stanbic IBTC office closest to you. For more information, call 01 271 6000 or email pensionsolution@stanbicibtc.com -

Can you provide the missing word? ‚ÄúPrevention is better than___‚Äô‚Äô As your financial advisers, your health is just as important to us as your wealth. You need to be alive & well first! 
Most people rarely go for medical check-ups, they think they don‚Äôt need one since, they are not actually sick yet. 
However, a routine preventive exam can identify potential health problems early when they may be easier to treat. 
Don't think ‚Äòif it is not broken, don‚Äôt fix it‚Äô. This works for appliances but is a poor approach for your health. 
This is why doctors say not to wait until you are sick to get physicals done, especially for people 40 years old and older 
So, why do you need regular medical check-ups?
‚û¢  To aid the early detection of ailments and prevention of complications that could be detrimental or cause death. ‚û¢  To detect if you have high or low blood sugar, hepatitis B & high or low blood pressure etc.
#HealthIsWealth #StanbicIBTC

This well thought-out asset allocation strategy ensures that you get the perfect balance between risk and reward. If stock prices fluctuate unfavourably, you will get at least your principal amount back. Yeah, wow! 
To protect you, there's a clause in the terms of agreement that ensures your principal is guaranteed as long as you keep the investment for a minimum of 3 months. Unbelievable right? 
This means that, if for any reason, the equities market performance declines, we guarantee that your principal will not reduce. 
Just like buying stocks, the SIGIF is sold in units. This means you buy at the prevailing offer price from us and sell at the prevailing bid price to redeem your investment.

This means that you can enjoy capital appreciation as prices go up and still earn annual dividends on your investment. 
What's more,  you get all the perks of investing in other Stanbic IBTC mutual fund investments.

So, what is a Private Trust? ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
Trust funds accumulated over a lifetime are not divided amongst your beneficiaries after one passes on but are retained as one fund to accumulate more wealth. Funds will have provision for payment to members of the family as the need arises while preserving some funds to continue growing. ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
Why is having a Private Trust necessary? Well, for one, it will help preserve your family wealth hence facilitate intergenerational wealth transfer according to your wishes. Other reasons you should consider a Private Trust are: (slide 3).
‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢

So, here are seven health tips to consider as the kids settle into school.

1. Get vaccinated.
- Children should get all vaccinations required especially if going to school for the first time. Make sure they're protected against common childhood diseases and illnesses.

2. Set bedtimes.
A healthy amount of sleep each night is needed to stay focused throughout the day. Consider making their bedtimes a little earlier each night for a week or two before school starts.

3. Teach good hygiene habits.
Ensure that their lunchbox is kept clean and hygienic. Teach them to wash their hands after using the restroom and before going to lunch or eating a snack.

4. Stock up on healthy foods.
Stock up on healthy foods like fruits, vegetables, whole-grain bread and lean protein like chicken. Avoid junk food. Good nutrition helps the child to focus and concentrate.

5. Manage school stress.
Back-to-school season is stressful for kids and parents alike.
Kids may have physical symptoms such as stomach aches and nausea from "making themselves sick over the worry and anxiety.

6. Backpack Problems
Make sure the backpack has wide straps and a padded back reaching to waist region. Inappropriately used backpack can expose child to issues such as back pain.

7. Be aware of allergens
Children who suffer from allergies suffer as dust mites, mold, and other allergens may be present in the classroom.

For some kids, it means a runny nose, sneezing, coughing, and watery eyes, which can also trigger asthma or lead indirectly to sinus infections.
-
-
We know that School can put pressure on children and parents/guardians. But we know you‚Äôve got this! We wish you all a fantastic school term. #WealthWednesday #BackToSchool #StanbicIBTC

On May 17, the world celebrated World Hypertension Day. Today, as we focus on health, we thought to spend it educating us a little so we can live better. Health is Wealth, right?
So, what really is hypertension? Hypertension is a health condition in which blood pressure is persistently elevated putting undue stress on the heart, blood vessels and other organs.

In 9 of 10 cases, the cause of hypertension cannot be identified. However, certain factors such as ‚Äì Hereditary, Environmental, Lifestyle (weight, diet, alcohol, smoking, physical inactivity and medication) are considered contributory. 
It is often referred to as the ‚Äòsilent killer‚Äô because it can exist with no obvious symptoms. The only way to detect it is by monitoring your blood pressure.

Blood pressure is not a fixed number. It varies with physical activity, excitement, time of day or night, and with emotional factors. This is why it is important to have your blood pressure taken under proper conditions and regularly. 
The higher the blood pressure, the greater the cardiovascular risk. The longer the duration of hypertension, the greater the cardiovascular risk.

No one's blood pressure is constant. Exercise or even a sudden burst of anger can raise our blood pressure readings, although not to dangerous levels or for long periods of time.
Secondly, it is a killer. People who have hypertension that is not treated are much more likely to die from or be disabled by complications such as strokes, heart attacks, heart failure, heart rhythm irregularities, and kidney failure than people who have normal blood pressure. 
Is hypertension treatable? It can be successfully managed but is not curable so what can you do to better manage your health? -	Be aware of your family‚Äôs medical history so you know if you are at risk. Always allow your BP to be taken whenever you are in the hospital and know and track your numbers. -	If you are at risk, please see a doctor and get treatment quickly. It‚Äôs always advisable to begin with healthy lifestyle changes.

A lot of us want to be wealthy but do not know how to make our money work for us. 
A great place to start this journey is to set your excess income aside in a low to medium risk type investment.
-
-
You may also choose to accumulate assets as early as you can afford them. 
An asset is something that has value. This meaning slightly differs in Accounting, which describes an asset as a resource with economic value that an individual, corporation or country owns or controls with the expectation that it will provide future benefit.
-
-
This simply means that anything you buy that makes you more money either by its use, or by selling it afterwards, is an asset.
-
-
So the next time you are faced with the financial decision of getting an asset, do keep in mind the value that can be derived from it.
-
-

Today is our health & wellness edition of #WealthWednesday, so we thought to shed more light on Autism & Autism Spectrum disorder as April is Autism Awareness month. 
Autism and autism¬†spectrum disorder (ASD) are both general terms for a group of complex disorders of brain development, characterized, in varying degrees, by difficulties in social interaction, verbal and nonverbal communication and repetitive behaviours.

Autism is a complex neurobehavioral condition that includes impairments in social interaction, developmental language and communication skills combined with rigid, repetitive behaviours. 
Autism¬†spectrum disorder¬†can¬†often be difficult to diagnose. At present, there's no official¬†test¬†for diagnosing¬†autism.

Most children affected by the disorder do not have intellectual disabilities, some study finds, and even among the severely low-functioning, about 10% may improve dramatically over time, with some growing out of their diagnosis by their teens.

So here are some strategies for promoting language development in nonverbal children and adolescents with autism.

Kokoro is a crunchy snack that can be eaten anytime. Try out this recipe by @dobbyssignature for the weekend and thank us later! Like if you love this! #StreetFood #Food #StanbicIBTC #FoodieFriday #TGIF #Snack

Ingredients
‚Ä¢ 1 cup of corn meal
‚Ä¢ 1 cup of flour ‚Ä¢ 2 tablespoon of sugar
‚Ä¢ A pinch of salt
‚Ä¢ 4 cups oil - for frying

Directions
Step 1: Pour 1 cup of water into a small pot and leave to boil. 
Step 2: Mix the corn meal, flour, sugar & salt together in a bowl. Add 1/2 of the corn mixture into the pot and stir. Remove the pot from the fire leave the mixture to cool. Once cool, add the rest of the corn mixture and mix. Transfer the dough into a bowl and knead till it becomes firm. 
Step 3: Take a portion of the dough and roll out on a flat surface till you get a long stick. Repeat the process for the rest of the batch. 
Step 4: Pour the oil into a pan and heat up till it gets hot. Deep fry the rolled out sticks till golden brown. 
Step 5: Transfer the fried Kokoro to a paper towel to drain off excess oil.

A Mutual fund is an investment scheme that pools investors‚Äô funds together to be expertly managed by a Fund Manager with the purpose of achieving returns better than they would have, had they invested individually.
.
.
How does a mutual fund work? It involves collection of money from various retail investors and then buying wholesale investments on their behalf and sharing the returns amongst the participants in line with their investment amounts.
.
.
Remember how Mumsy used to collabo with a group of friends to buy foodstuffs from the market in bulk, and then they‚Äôd split amongst themselves to save cost and get better quality foodstuff? This works similarly. .
.
Just like a banker will offer a better rate to a depositor with N5,000,000 than to one with N100,000. Mutual funds remind us that we can come together so that our N100,000 earns like returns with the N5,000,000. .
.
Everyone brings what they have, N5,000, N10,000, N1m and the money together forms a pool of cash that can be invested. These funds are then managed by a Fund Manager like Stanbic IBTC Asset management who makes all the investment decisions.
.
.
One of the benefits you get is having access to returns from the total amount in the fund alongside all the other investors. So all you do is put your money in, and watch it grow as you earn returns on your investment. .
.
Mutual funds are also open-ended, that means you do not have to wait till a specific time to get your money out. Also, your investment is liquid (easily converted to cash) at any time you need it. Sounds good right? .
.
And with access to an online platform similar to your internet banking, you can keep an eye on your funds, make additional investments, partial or full withdrawals and even switch between different fund types at any time. .
.
Are you wondering what form of investment is suitable for you? Would you like additional clarification? #FoodieFriday: Hey #Foodies! Settle in this weekend with this yummy potato casserole recipe by @dobbyssignature #FoodieFriday

Ingredients
‚Ä¢ 4 medium Sized Irish potatoes
‚Ä¢ 4 eggs
‚Ä¢ 1 medium sized chili pepper
‚Ä¢ 1 medium sized Green pepper
‚Ä¢ 1/2 small onion
‚Ä¢ 1/2 cup milk (1tbsp. powdered milk + 1/2 cup water)
‚Ä¢ 1/2 tsp. Salt
‚Ä¢ 1/2 cup of flour

Directions
- Dice the green pepper, chili pepper, onion and potatoes.
- Place potatoes and water in a dish. Cover and bake in oven on high for 7 minutes or until tender; drain. - Beat the Eggs well, add the milk, salt and flour and mix. Gently add the veggies including the potato and stir well to incorporate. - Pour the mixture into an oven proof pan or dish and place in the oven. Bake, uncovered, at 350¬∞ for 30-40mins or until center is set on medium heat till it firms up. Serve!

You might have guests coming over this holiday season. Having light snacks can help keep your guests entertained before the main course. Puff-puff is favourite!
üì∑ @dobbyssignature

Ingredients
‚Ä¢ 250g flour
‚Ä¢ 1 tablespoon of yeast
‚Ä¢ 2 eggs - Optional
‚Ä¢ 150 ml warm water
‚Ä¢ 4 tablespoons of sugar
‚Ä¢ A pinch of salt
‚Ä¢ Vegetable oil for deep frying

Directions
- Pour the yeast into the bowl of warm water, cover and set aside for about 10 minutes
- In a different bowl, mix the sugar and plain flour together. Make a well in the center of the dry ingredients and then pour the yeast mixture into it.
- Add the whisked egg and mix the batter till it has a thick consistency. Cover and set aside.
- In a frying pan, heat the oil on medium heat. Once the oil gets hot, scoop small balls into the hot oil with a table spoon or with the hollow of your hand.
- Fry for about 3 mins on both sides till golden brown, then drain out and leave to cool.
-Serve with a chilled drink

Monkey Pox is a contagious disease caused by a virus closely related to the Chicken and Small Pox viruses. Contact with infected animals, especially those found sick or dead, greatly increases the chances of contracting the disease. The Nigerian Centre for Disease Control (NCDC) is closely monitoring and the disease. If you notice severe headaches, fever, backpain and boil like rashes, please call: 0806 698 7752 & 0803 547 4676 #WealthWednesday

Mosa is a delightful snack anytime. Try out @dobbyssignature‚Äôs plantain mosa recipe #Foodgasm #Foodporn #Friday #FoodieFriday 
Ingredients
‚Ä¢1 medium sized over-ripe plantain
‚Ä¢10 tablespoon of flour
‚Ä¢1 tablespoon of yeast
‚Ä¢1 cup of warm water
‚Ä¢1 scotch bonnet pepper, diced
‚Ä¢Salt to taste
‚Ä¢Vegetable oil (for deep frying)

How to prepare
- Slice and blend till smooth. Add the diced scotch bonnet pepper, yeast and warm water.
-Cover the batter and leave to stand for about 20 minutes. While the batter stands, place the pan on fire and pour in the oil to heat up.
- Beat the batter once more and scoop small teaspoons. of it into the oil. This could also be done with the hollow of your washed hand just like puff puff.
- Fry till Golden brown and scoop out onto a paper towel to drain off excess oil. Serve as a snack with a chilled drink.

To process the application for change of date of birth, the following documents are required: (first slide)üëç In addition to the documents listed above, RSA holders in the public sector are required to provide a Record of Service from their employers.

We‚Äôre not judging oh but you really should give your correct date of birth on official documents.

For example, with your pension account, your age has to be consistent on all your documents to be able to get your pension.

At the point of withdrawal, proof of age (a birth certificate or sworn age declaration) is a mandatory requirement.

The date of birth stated on the proof of age document must be the same as the date of birth on our database and @pencomng‚Äôs database. 
If there is a disparity, an application for change of date of birth must be sent to @pencomng through your PFA for approval before the change can be effected #WealthWednesday #Pension #StanbicIBTC #RetireWell

Welcome to another edition of our weekly series #WealthWednesday.

Retirement is an important milestone and every now and then, we celebrate a retirement, for a parent or a close relative.

We know you get worried about how they will fare now that they are retired. Will they get their money? When? All valid concerns.

If your parents are due to retire soon, you will want to know what will happen next. Today, we‚Äôll tell you about annuities.

With pensions, an annuity is a guaranteed, regular payment that removes the risk of retirees running out of #money.

An annuity guarantees that the retiree gets a payment from the PFA on a monthly, quarterly, bi annual or annual basis.

With the annuity option, one gets a lump sum payment with the rest of the retirement savings sent to an insurance company.  Only approved insurance companies can offer annuity products & the investment of annuity funds is supervised by @PenComNig 
Stanbic IBTC Insurance Brokers will provide quotes on annuity from different insurance companies so retirees have a choice. 
Our insurance brokers also ensure that the retirees‚Äô beneficiaries get the necessary benefits in the event of death. #WealthWednesday #Retirement #Pension #Annuity

Why do we need to pay attention to getting good sleep? 
Sleep Deprivation can cause daytime sleepiness. #WealthWednesday #Relax #HealthIsWealth #StanbicIBTC

Hey guys! Back to the hustle from the long weekend! 
For today‚Äôs #WealthWednesday we will be discussing the importance of sleep. I mean, sleep is essential to your health.

Sleep is a basic necessity of life. It is as important as air, food and water. It determines if we wake up feeling refreshed, alert and ready for the day. 
Sleep is important because it also determines if our jobs, relationships, productivity, health and safety will suffer.

So let‚Äôs do a little Sleep Diagnosis. How do you sleep? 
If you said yes to one or more of the above listed symptoms, you just may be sleep deficient. Sleep deprivation  does have long term negative effects. 
Although sleep experts generally recommend an average of 7-9 hours per night, some people can get along with less while others need as much as 10 hours to feel alert the next day. 
Let‚Äôs look up a few sleep myths. 
1. You can "cheat" on the amount of sleep you get.
Sleep experts say most adults need between 7-9 hours of sleep each night for optimum performance, health and safety. 
When we don't get adequate sleep, we accumulate a sleep debt that can be difficult to "pay back" if it becomes too big. 
2. Snoring is a common problem, especially among men, but it isn‚Äôt harmful. #Rest #TakeABreak #HealthIsWealth

Whether you can remove the stressor or not, you should practice techniques to prevent the stress response from taking over your body.

How?
Exercise regularly: Be involved in any activity that raises your heart rate and relaxes your mind and body. 30 minutes of daily heart-pounding activity is recommended.

Laugh: Don‚Äôt take yourself too seriously. Try to find joy in everything.

Eat healthy and regularly: Eating small but frequent meals can help your body maintain an even level of blood sugar, keep your energy up, stay focused, and avoid mood swings.

Sleep well: Rest is a key factor in coping with workplace stress. Sleep for 6-8 hours every 24 hours.

Don‚Äôt get angry: Do not go beyond consternation into fury or rage. Anger brings on stress too.

Get a massage: A proper massage can help ease tense muscles and relieve pain and discomfort.

Drink water: Lots of water. You should aim to drink 6-8 glasses of water a day. #WealthWednesday #StanbicIBTC

Many of us think depression is simply sadness. It isn‚Äôt. Sadness is a normal reaction to difficult events and periods and we usually get over it.

Sadness is only a small part of depression. Some people with depression may not feel sadness at all. Depression has many other symptoms, including physical ones.

When a person has depression, it interferes with daily life & normal functioning. It can cause pain for the person with depression and those who care about them. #WealthWednesday

Hey #foodies! @dobbysignature shredded ginger beef looks yummy. Why not try something different this weekend.
 #FoodieFriday #Foodie #Food
Ingredients
‚Ä¢ 1lb (pound) of boneless beef
‚Ä¢ 1 medium sized ginger ‚Ä¢ 6 cloves of garlic ‚Ä¢ 1 medium sized onion ‚Ä¢ 1 tablespoon of rosemary ‚Ä¢ 1 tablespoon of ground nutmeg ‚Ä¢ 2 tablespoons of chili pepper - ground ‚Ä¢ 2 seasoning cubes ‚Ä¢ Salt to taste ‚Ä¢ 2 cups of cucumber (optional)- diced ‚Ä¢ 1 cups of carrot (optional) - diced 
How to prepare
-Slice the beef into small stripes. Add salt, nutmeg, rosemary, crushed seasoning, onion, ginger and cook. -Cook for 30 minutes till it's tender. -Add the minced garlic, pepper and cook. - Reduce the heat then add the diced cucumber and carrot. Leave to simmer for 3 minutes on low heat. -Serve as a side dish with rice, yam, potato etc.

This week, we would be discussing Tuberculosis.

Tuberculosis (TB) is an infectious disease that usually affects the lungs.  Compared with other diseases caused by a single infectious agent, TB is the second biggest killer globally and it remains a serious health challenge in developing countries including Nigeria.

TB is spread through the air from one person to another. The TB germs are passed through the air when a person who is infected with the disease coughs, laughs, sings, or sneezes. Though highly contagious, but it is not easy to catch.

The chances of spreading TB to someone you live or work with are much higher than to a stranger so, here are some ways to stop the spread of tuberculosis. #WealthWednesday

World Diabetes Day is celebrated every year on November 14.

Today‚Äôs edition of #WealthWednesday will focus on ‚ÄòWomen and Diabetes - right to a healthy future‚Äô, as diabetes is the ninth leading cause of death in women globally, causing 21 million deaths each year. ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
Here are some facts about diabetes: read up on image slide 2 ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
Although any woman can develop gestational diabetes, certain risk factors predispose some women more, these include: read up on image slide 4 ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
While most women with gestational diabetes mellitus deliver healthy babies if properly managed, uncontrolled blood sugar levels can cause problems for both the mother and the baby, including the likelihood of needing a C-section for delivery. ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
While there are no guarantees to preventing gestational diabetes, the healthier the habits you adopt, the better. To reduce the risk of developing GDM in future pregnancies or developing type 2 diabetes, follow these tips.

This week we‚Äôll be discussing the importance of having a travel insurance policy. Let‚Äôs start by asking, how often do you take up a travel insurance policy? 
________________________
Why is travel insurance necessary? Well, It is designed to provide financial protection for unexpected events during one‚Äôs trip.

Wondering if and why you need travel insurance? Here are a few benefits to consider;
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ The insurer will provide the individual with dental assistance required abroad.
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ The insurer will pay the cost of hospitalization, surgery, medical fees and pharmaceutical products, prescribed by the attending doctor.
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ Should the insured be hospitalized due to sudden illness or accident for more than 10 days, the insurer will meet the cost of repatriating one immediate family member accompanying the insured at the time of the event to his usual place of residence.
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ The insurer will be responsible for transferring the individual to a properly equipped health centre and repatriating the insured to his/her usual country of residence.
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ Where insured‚Äôs trip is interrupted by the death of a close relative (as defined by the policy) ,the insurer will cover travel costs whenever the insured is unable to personally cover such trips.
‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ ‚Ä¢ In the event of the death of the insured, the insurance company will necessary arrangements for the return of the insured‚Äôs remains to the insured‚Äôs country of citizenship.  However, travel insurance is not eligible for the following categories;

Individual intending to travel more than 92 consecutive days

Persons of less than 3 months age

Persons aged from 81 years old

Non-residents in the country where the insurance is issued.

Having a #Will in place gives an #Assurance that whatever wishes and dreams you have for your family are maintained whether or not you are there by leaving a #Legacee. 
Leaving a #Legacee is way simpler than you think. It can start simply as the desire to keep your memories alive. 
If you want to preserve a family business for generations to come, you need to leave a #Legacee. 
Beyond this, you can also leave a #Legacee for your immediate family. It‚Äôs like giving your wishes life even when you may not be here.

When you leave a #Legacee, there is no disputing what you may have wanted and your loved ones will be grateful for it. 
When you leave a #Legacee, there is no disputing what you may have wanted and your loved ones will be grateful for it. 
You can prevent extended family hassles over your hard earned assets when you are gone by leaving a #Legacee.

A #Legacee can protect your children from gender discrimination whilst your assets are being distributed. It ensures that you have the final say. 
A smart way to leave a #Legacee is by writing a #Will.

We know that for some of us, writing a #Will has an air of finality and may feel like a death sentence. No, it is not. 
Writing a #Will is being proactive about the certainty of death and ensuring that you are not taken unawares. 
You don‚Äôt have to wait until you are old and retired, it simply has to do with having a say as regards the assets you leave behind. 
You don‚Äôt have to be rich too. Your RSA and bank account balances are assets that you can cover in your #Legacee. 
Now is the time to shape the future of those you love. You can write a story today that will be read in your own words tomorrow. 
Your #Legacee today can make a difference. Even in your final moments, you will be assured that you made your mark. 
Take the first steps towards leaving a #Legacee today. Let us help you. #WealthWednesday

Hi guys, it‚Äôs another edition of our #WealthWednesday series today, so we decided to share some useful insurance related tips. ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
First your car: Did you know that your car‚Äôs insurance status can be confirmed online? 
Copy and paste this in browser üëâ bit.ly/2HqvVs1

In the event that your car isn‚Äôt insured and the comprehensive policy is looking very pricey ‚Äì you have an option: ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
Third Party Insurance. A Third party insurance policy does not provide any benefit to you (the insured) but it covers your legal liability for death/disability of third-party (the other party) loss or damage to the third party property. Ask us how we can help. ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
Remember this: Your insurer is liable for the repair of the third party‚Äôs car since you can also make a claim where you are responsible for the damage. ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
Group Life Insurance: If you're an employee in a firm with up to 3 staff, it's also compulsory to have a group life insurance policy in place. This ensures a pay out of up to 3 times your annual emolument in the event of death. So, ask your employer about it. ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
Health Insurance: It is advisable for your employer to have a Health Insurance package in place for employees. This ensures that your medical expenses are covered in the case of ill health and helps you avoid out of pocket medical expenses.

Seriously guys, you really can and should insure anything you consider valuable; phones, tablets, laptops‚Ä¶ you name it! Then you can make a claim if these valuables get stolen or damaged. ‚Ä¢
‚Ä¢
Lastly, get familiar with our INSURANCE BROKERAGE services. We‚Äôd love to hear from you. #StanbicIBTC #Insurance

Last week we celebrated the International Women‚Äôs Day globally and Sunday was Mother‚Äôs Day for many people across the globe.

Today, our #WealthWednesday will be focusing on Women‚Äôs Health.üòâ Women and men share many similar health problems, but women also have their own health issues, which deserve special consideration and it is also helpful that men understand and are supportive of the health concerns of the women. .
.
A few women specific health issues are- breast cancer, cervical cancer, and bone density screenings. Issues unique to women include pregnancy, menopause, and conditions of the female organs. .
.
Some diseases occur at a higher frequency in women. Gallstones are three to four times more common in women than in men as are migraine headaches at a ratio of three females to one male. Also, the effects of sexually transmitted diseases can be more serious in women. .
.

The biggest threats to women's health are often preventable. Here's what you need to know to live a longer, healthier life.

1. Follow a Heart-Healthy Diet

2. Exercise Every Day

3. Visit Your Doctor

Do you know your employer should remit your pension payments no later than seven (7) days after your salary is paid? .
.
Beyond the fact that making pension contributions is compulsory in Nigeria, these contributions serve as a great place to start planning towards that retirement you deserve. .
.
The best advice is to become more deliberate about contributing towards your pension. So here are a few tips on how to make this happen. .
.
Monitor your account: There are several easy options to help you monitor the inflows into your pension account. Monitoring helps you determine if the contributions into your account are consistent and adequate to fund the retirement you dream of.

Have a plan and write it down so you can work towards your goal. Here‚Äôs the link to our pension calculator to help you forecast and plan right: bit.ly/2sIQGIC
.
. 
Take action: Using your plan, will your current monthly payment be sufficient to fund your retirement? If not, you may need to augment the amount your employer remits by making additional voluntary contributions. .
.

Enumerate the goals you had set out at the beginning of the year and a corresponding checklist of questions to review each goal. E.g. If the goal was to save X Naira by the year end, your review questions could be: What % of my target did i hit? And so on‚Ä¶

Consider all the changes in your life in 2017. New car? An addition to your family? Promotion or a raise? These changes should feature in your financial goals for next year.

If you got a promotion, you may be thinking about saving more for retirement. Your beloved new baby could do with a trust fund to ensure he/she is SET for the life you‚Äôve imagined. Your new car may require a comprehensive insurance policy... Make sure your finances are in order.

Nutritious and delicious is what comes to mind when you think of Edikang Ikong soup and we can‚Äôt agree more. You should try @dobbyssignature recipe tomorrow if you‚Äôre in need of a tasty lunch/dinner. #Foodie #FoodieFriday #Food

Ingredients
‚Ä¢ 450g afang "okazi" leaves (4 handfuls)
‚Ä¢ 1 kg fresh water leaves
‚Ä¢ 400g periwinkles ‚Ä¢ 400g red beef
‚Ä¢ assorted meat
‚Ä¢ 2 fresh scotch bonnet pepper ‚Ä¢ 2 seasoning cubes ‚Ä¢ 1 small stock fish part ‚Ä¢ 1 small dry fish ‚Ä¢ 1 cooking spoon crayfish ‚Ä¢ 1 cup palm oil ‚Ä¢ salt to taste

How to cook - Wash, grind or pound the afang leaves.
- Wash the beef, stockfish, dryfish, sharki, pomo and place in a small pot. Add the seasoning cubes, salt, pepper and cook till its soft.
- Add palm oil, then leave to boil for 15 mins. After then, add crayfish and perwinkles.
-  Add the ground or pounded afang. Leave to cook further for 5 mins.
- Add the chopped water-leaves. Leave to cook for 5 mins. The water leaves tends to bring out more water once it gets into the soup so ensure the liquid in the pot is very little before adding water leaves.
- Ready to eat.

What do you understand by group life insurance policy?

The group life insurance policy is a statutory policy taken by the employer to limit the financial burden on the employee‚Äôs beneficiaries should the employee pass on. The employer is responsible for the annual premium payment but in the event of death, the benefits are paid to the beneficiary of the insured. 
The amount paid by the insurance company will be a minimum of three times the annual total emolument of the employee.

Signing up for a life insurance policy is something you should consider, especially for the sake of your loved ones. Let us advise you how, contact us via insurancesolution@stanbicibtc.com or call us on 01-2770394. #WealthWednesday #StanbicIBTC #Insurance

Today we are focusing on men and their health. Health is wealth you know? .
.
We all need to pay attention to our health to be honest. But since we are focusing on the male folks today; did you know that compared to women, men are more likely to ÔÉò * Make unhealthy or risky choices ÔÉò * Put off regular check-ups and medical care .
.
There are also health conditions that only affect men, such as prostate cancer and low testosterone. However, many of the major health risks that men face - like colon cancer or heart disease - can be prevented and treated with early diagnosis. .
.

Ensure you leave a Legacee, by writing a will. Why, you may ask? Executors of a will be notified to commence the probate process once death occurs. The probate process involves notifying all institutions where assets are held to forestall imposters from accessing funds. 
Don‚Äôt think you are ‚Äò‚Äôrich‚Äô‚Äô enough? Your Retirement Savings and bank accounts are a good place to start. 
It‚Äôs not enough to think about leaving a Legacee‚Ä¶get started by writing a will. #NeverStopMovingForward #WealthWednesday

Here it goes: A lady went to complain at a bank about withdrawals from her recently deceased husband‚Äôs account. She had received several alerts & discovered all the monies had been withdrawn. Not by her! The bank officials ran their checks and the cameras showed that her husband had made the withdrawals. 
She was quite shocked but she produced a death certificate confirming her husband‚Äôs demise prior to said dates. 
Guess who the impersonator was? His identical twin brother! üòÆ
The deceased‚Äôs estranged twin had impersonated his brother and withdrawn his funds leaving his widow and children stranded. 
You may think we just fried you some nice, juicy, soft, dodo‚Ä¶but it really did happen. üòâ

The answer is 21. Line one: The mango is equivalent to 7.

Line two: 5+7=12; the grape is equivalent to 12.

Line three: 1+grape bunch=7; banana bunch is equivalent to 6 because 6+1=7 (Note: there are three oranges in the bunch so 1 orange would equal 2 since 6/3 equals 2). Line four: 7 +12+2=21

But if you have more than one Retirement Savings Account, no worries. All you need do is apply for a reconciliation through your PFA.

The reconciliation is done by the governing body for pensions in Nigeria: @pencomng.

Usually, your first Pension Account is considered as the valid one, whether it‚Äôs your preferred or not. (We hope we are your one and only üòâ) When this is confirmed, your second Pension Fund Administrator gets approval from @pencomng and sends your remitted funds to the valid Retirementirement Savings Account.

And that‚Äôs all there is to know about resolving issues with multiple RSA accounts.

If you have any questions about your retirement savings account, or pensions in general, we are here to help. #WealthWednesday

Creating and maintaining wealth requires self-discipline. 
When looking to create wealth, the aim is to put money you‚Äôve saved into investments you expect to appreciate over time.

Instruments like stocks, bonds and real estate are useful investment tools. The goal is to sell your investment at a higher price than the purchase price in order to make a profit.

This can be done on your own, through a licensed professional or a financial institution.

However, the very first step is a desire to be financially independent and the willingness to do what it takes.

What‚Äôs the first thing you do once you get paid?

Most people believe the key to wealth is a high-paying job but ‚Äúearning money‚Äù and ‚Äúcreating wealth‚Äù are really two different things.

Earning an income is great ‚Ä¶ it pays the bills ‚Ä¶ keeps body and soul together, but typically, that‚Äôs money that goes into your pocket and right back out. 
However, wealth is a lot more than just earning a good pay. Wealth Creation begins with spending less than you actually earn.

Wealth creation then involves profitably applying those monies you chose not to spend. After all, you need these resources to create and take advantage of opportunities in life.

Saving and investing money are habits that need to be consciously and consistently cultivated in order to build wealth. #WealthWednesday #StanbicIBTC

Here are some of the annuity types we offer‚Ä¶

Level Income ‚Äì This is a fixed payment plan where the retiree collects the same amount of pension from start of the policy to the end.

Spouse Annuity ‚Äì This policy provides cover for your spouse up to 50%, 75% and 100% of your pension. When the retiree dies, the spouse automatically becomes the annuitant and gets the payments for the rest of their life.

Increasing Annuity ‚Äì This plan allows for an increase in the annuity amount at each policy anniversary. The standard increase offered is usually 5% or 7.5% each year on a compounding basis.

Beyond work place stress, managing stress starts with:

a.  Fixing

b.  Accepting

c.  Protecting.

#WealthWednesday #StanbicIBTC

How to manage workplace stress ‚Äì

Create a balanced schedule: Analyze your schedule, responsibilities, and daily tasks. Try to find a balance between work and family life and social activity.

Distinguish between the ‚Äòshoulds‚Äô and the ‚Äòmusts‚Äô: Sort out the urgent and important from the nice to haves. Don‚Äôt overload yourself.

Plan regular breaks: Deliberately take short breaks throughout the day to take a walk or sit back and clear your mind. Stepping away from work to briefly relax and recharge will improve productivity.

Take a holiday: We mean a real holiday where you relax and can be adventurous- not just a shopping holiday.

Know your body: Your body speaks. Listen to it and seek medical advice when you feel unwell. 
Be deliberate about planning rest and recreation into your schedule. It will restore your creativity, fuel your vision, and bring balance to your world. #StanbicIBTC #WealthWednesday

Sometimes, work gets the better of us and leaves us stressed out. Which of these do you feel often?

Types of Workplace Stress

Time Stress ‚Äì Are you worrying about not having enough time? Could be due to a heavy workload or unrealistic deadline.

Situational Stress ‚Äì Some work situations involve conflict, or a loss of status with your colleagues. For instance, making a major mistake that your team is aware of.

Anticipatory Stress - This is stress experienced concerning the future. Anxiety about closing a specific deal or for an upcoming presentation, perhaps?

Encounter Stress - Encounter stress revolves around your interactions with clients or colleagues in the work place. Could be colleagues you don‚Äôt like or difficult clients. #WealthWednesday #StanbicIBTC

If you identify some of these symptoms in yourself, you may be unduly stressed. Unhealthy stress levels could have adverse effects on your health. Related illnesses include:
Hypertension, Ulcers, Stroke, Depression, drug abuse, headaches, recurrent common ailment like Flu, recurrent malaria episodes  #WealthWednesday

Are you stressed? Let‚Äôs do a Self-Check. 
Cognitive Symptoms -Memory problems, Inability to concentrate, Poor Judgment, Anxious or racing thought, less effective thinking

Emotional Symptoms ‚Äì Moodiness, Irritability or short temper, Inability to relax, Feeling overwhelmed, Sense of loneliness & Isolation, Depression or general unhappiness

Behavioral Symptoms - Eating more or less, Sleeping too much or too little, Isolating yourself from others, Procrastinating or neglecting responsibilities, Nervous habits (Nail biting, pacing), Missing deadlines/Argumentative

Physical Symptoms - Aches & Pains, Diarrhea or constipation, Nausea and / or dizziness, Chest pain /Rapid heartbeat, Frequent cold/low energy,  Constant tiredness #WealthWednesday #StanbicIBTC #TimeOut

This week, we'll be discussing Stress Management.

Whilst stress is inevitable, distress is not. Today, we would like to focus on you. Are you managing your stress well?

There are different types of depression. Symptoms can range from relatively minor to very severe, so its helpful to be aware of the range of conditions and symptoms. #WealthWednesday

As the pressure of life mounts, we must be more watchful for those we love. Please notice the signs and symptoms and show some more understanding. 
If you think you may have depression, start by making an appointment to see your doctor or health care provider.

Just talk to someone. Many more people than you think will care. #WealthWednesday

Sometimes it can be difficult to distinguish grief from major depression. However, grief that is complicated and lasts for a very long time following a loss may require treatment. 
Older adults who had depression when they were younger are more at risk for developing depression in later life.

Depression, even the most severe cases, can be treated. The earlier treatment begins, the more effective it is.

Most adults see an improvement in their symptoms when treated with antidepressant drugs, talk therapy (psychotherapy), or a combination of both. #WealthWednesday

They are likely to be very irritable, lose interest in once-pleasurable activities, and have difficulty sleeping. They may act recklessly. 
Some people turn to alcohol or drugs when they are depressed. They also may become frustrated, discouraged, irritable, angry and abusive. 
Some may throw themselves into their work to avoid talking about their depression with family or friends. #WealthWednesday

Older children and teens with depression may sulk, get into trouble at school, be negative and irritable, and feel misunderstood. 
If you‚Äôre unsure if an adolescent in your life is depressed or just ‚Äúbeing a teenager,‚Äù consider how long the symptoms have been present, how severe they are, and how different the teen is acting from his or her usual self. 
Teens with depression may also have other disorders such as anxiety, eating disorders, or substance abuse. They may also be at higher risk for suicide.

Adults with depression do not all experience the same symptoms. Typical symptoms include sadness, worthlessness, and guilt. #WealthWednesday

Depression can happen at any age, but often begins in the teens or early 20s or 30s. 
The severity and frequency of symptoms, and how long they last, will vary depending on the individual.

Even children can get depression. The child may pretend to be sick, refuse to go to school, cling to a parent, or worry that a parent may die. 
Because normal behaviors vary from one childhood stage to another, it can be difficult to tell if a child is just going through a ‚Äúphase‚Äù or is suffering from depression. #WealthWednesday

There are many factors that play a role in depression. A few of them are: #WealthWednesday

Genetics, brain biology and chemistry, and life events such as trauma, loss of a loved one, a difficult relationship, an early childhood experience, or any stressful situation.

Depression is not a sign of a person‚Äôs weakness or a character flaw. It is important to not diminish people for being depressed. 
You can‚Äôt just ‚Äúsnap out of‚Äù clinical depression and most people who experience depression need treatment to get better. 
If you have been experiencing any of the following signs and symptoms for at least 2 weeks, you may be suffering from depression #WealthWednesday

And because Trust assets do not go through Probate, the trust is not subject to estate tax, when you pass on. 
You‚Äôre also assured of confidentiality under a Trust unlike a Will which is a public document that can be viewed in a court.

What‚Äôs the best thing about a trust? The assets are continually invested by our Investment Managers, so the assets grow to keep providing value.

Make a smart decision today by preserving your assets for your loved ones #WealthWednesday #EstatePlan #PreservingAssets

A Trust lets you to set aside some assets for a particular objective by passing the rights to the assets to a trustee.

A quick explanation of the terms;
With a Living Trust, you get a first-hand experience of how your wishes would be adhered to when you pass on.

A Corporate Trust is a going concern and does not die, you are rest assured that the objective of the Trust would be adhered to.

Assets transferred into a Living Trust go to your beneficiaries in line with your wishes avoiding the delay and expenses of the Probate process. #WealthWednesday

‚Ä¶And even then, your assets could still be distributed using Customary Law. Sometimes to the detriment of those closest to you. 
This all sounds a bit depressing and it really is. Imagine others gaining the benefit of your life‚Äôs work while your loved ones struggle.

It‚Äôs time to put your wishes down in a Will to avoid family disputes and ensure your loved ones are well taken care of.

If you‚Äôre trying to decide on what to prepare for dinner @dobbysignature‚Äôs simple and delicious chicken stir fry recipe looks so good. #FoodieFriday #Food #Foodie #StanbicIBTC

Ingredients ‚Ä¢ 1/2 kilo of chicken ‚Ä¢ 1 tablespoon of curry powder ‚Ä¢ 1 tablespoon of thyme ‚Ä¢ 2 seasoning cubes ‚Ä¢ 2 medium sized onion ‚Ä¢ 3 tablespoon of vegetable oil ‚Ä¢ 3 tablespoon of soy sauce ‚Ä¢ 3 tablespoon of corn starch/ plain flour ‚Ä¢ 1 tablespoon of ginger, minced ‚Ä¢ 1 tablespoon of garlic, minced ‚Ä¢ 1 tablespoon of chili pepper ‚Ä¢ 2 medium sized green bell pepper ‚Ä¢ 3 medium sized red bell pepper ‚Ä¢ 1 handful green beans ‚Ä¢ 1 cup green peas ‚Ä¢ Salt to taste

How to prepare - Remove the seeds from the bell peppers, and chop them into long strips - Set this aside. Chop one onion and the green beans into large chunks - Set this aside. - Fillet the chicken and cut into smaller pieces. Add the seasoning cubes, curry, thyme, ginger, chili pepper and salt. Cook for 10 minutes. - Add the oil in a frying pan and heat for 15 seconds. Add the cooked chicken (without the stock) and fry for 2 minutes. -Add the onions to the chicken and stir-fry for 1 minute, then add the soy sauce, green peas and vegetables. Stir-fry for about 1-2 minutes. - To make the sauce, pour the corn starch or plain flour into the chicken stock and mix. Cook for about 3 minutes till it thickens. Pour this into the chicken stir-fry and mix. -Leave to simmer for about 2 minutes and serve hot.
